author: jerenkrantz
msg: ra_serf: Fix up pool issues and track/clean up empty directories.
We can now checkout an extracted httpd tarball without substantial memory leaks.
(We could do without tracking the dirs explicitly; but we'll leave it in so
that it's easy to debug this situation.)
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/update.c:
(report_dir_t): Add a pool for the baton; note our children and siblings.
(report_context_t): Store a pointer to our root so we can clean up later.
(push_state): Use calloc instead of alloc; point to ->root_dir or siblings
as appropriate.
(open_dir): Create the pool for the baton when we need it.
(close_dir): Use new pools; when we close, update our parent's children list.
(close_all_dirs): Walk from the directory and close all children.
(handle_fetch): Create a sub-pool from the dir_baton for the file and use it.
(delta_file, fetch_file): Use 'right' pool.
(finish_report): Always delay closing the dir and ensure they are closed
in the order we found them (i.e. FIFO); close all children at the end.

author: julianfoad
msg: Improve the robustness of tools/dev/warn-ignored-err.sh.
* tools/dev/warn-ignored-err.sh
Rearrange the sequence of moves and modifications to reduce the chance that
a source file will be missing or truncated if the script is interrupted.
Now there is little chance of the former and none of the latter.
